KH.content: acc. Hegel, Plato uses myth because he’s impotent, a ludico-mythological drift (dérive), Aristotle Hegel’s guarantor of seriousness
KH.linkedContent: acc. Hegel, Plato uses myth because he’s impotent, a ludico-mythological drift (dérive), Aristotle Hegel’s guarantor of seriousness

GT.content: the es gibt plays (spielt), play of 4’s as play of gift, manifests the unity of time’s 3 dimensions, la donne de ce jeu [relance], & la doña, la femme qui nous a requis depuis l’exergue [Derrida then mentions a fine book, Finas’ Donne, which interlaces all these themes]
GT.linkedContent: the es gibt plays (spielt), play of 4’s as play of gift, manifests the unity of time’s 3 dimensions, la donne de ce jeu [relance], & la doña, la femme qui nous a requis depuis l’exergue [Derrida then mentions a fine book, Finas’ Donne, which interlaces all these themes]

R.content: undecidability, play, in the interpretation of the democratic
R.linkedContent: undecidability, play, in the interpretation of the democratic

BL.content: literature makes law, power of performativity—sidestep existing laws which condition its emergence (jouer la loi [play, deceive the law])
BL.linkedContent: literature makes law, power of performativity—sidestep existing laws which condition its emergence (jouer la loi [play, deceive the law])

EM.content: Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being)
EM.linkedContent: Heidegger destroys privilege of present-now (Gegenwart) by way of a presence (Anwesen, Anwesenheit) which 3 modes of present (present-present, past-present, future-present) can’t exhaust > provides playing space (l’espace de jeu) on basis of the fourfold (On Time and Being)

EM.content: prescription of the end of man, prescribed since always, has done nothing but “modulate equivocality of the end, in the play of telos and death”
EM.linkedContent: prescription of the end of man, prescribed since always, has done nothing but “modulate equivocality of the end, in the play of telos and death”

EM.content: dans la lecture de ce jeu: le fin de l’homme est la pensée de l’être, l’homme est la fin de la pensée de l’être, la fin de l’homme est la fin de la pensée de l’être > l’homme est depuis toujours sa propre fin, c’est-a-dire la fin de son propre > l’être est depuis toujours sa propre fin, c’est-à-dire la fin de son propre
EM.linkedContent: dans la lecture de ce jeu: le fin de l’homme est la pensée de l’être, l’homme est la fin de la pensée de l’être, la fin de l’homme est la fin de la pensée de l’être > l’homme est depuis toujours sa propre fin, c’est-a-dire la fin de son propre > l’être est depuis toujours sa propre fin, c’est-à-dire la fin de son propre

PP.content: pure play of traces [see POOF pp. 75-7] , supplements w/out transcendental signified, no absolutely external reference, on and on infinitely, is not w/out its own violence
PP.linkedContent: pure play of traces [see POOF pp. 75-7] , supplements w/out transcendental signified, no absolutely external reference, on and on infinitely, is not w/out its own violence

PP.content: Thoth puts play into play, repeats in play of supplement, his propriety or property is impropriety, inappropriateness, floating indetermination allows for substitution and play
PP.linkedContent: Thoth puts play into play, repeats in play of supplement, his propriety or property is impropriety, inappropriateness, floating indetermination allows for substitution and play

PP.content: pharmakon is “ambivalent,” from out of its reserve, dans son ombre et sa veille indécises, opposites are opposed, carved out (découper), crosses borders of dualities, it is the movement, locus of play: (the production of) difference, differance of difference, before opposites, not the punctual simplicity of a coincidentia oppositorum [dialectics], fonds sans fond, exceeds, nothing in itself
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon is “ambivalent,” from out of its reserve, dans son ombre et sa veille indécises, opposites are opposed, carved out (découper), crosses borders of dualities, it is the movement, locus of play: (the production of) difference, differance of difference, before opposites, not the punctual simplicity of a coincidentia oppositorum [dialectics], fonds sans fond, exceeds, nothing in itself

PP.content: good-writing is serious (spoudē), pharmakon, ephemeral produce is a game (paidia)
PP.linkedContent: good-writing is serious (spoudē), pharmakon, ephemeral produce is a game (paidia)

PP.content: Plato moves dividing line btwn presence and trace (ikhnos) to dialectical trace and nondialectical trace: good play and bad play
PP.linkedContent: Plato moves dividing line btwn presence and trace (ikhnos) to dialectical trace and nondialectical trace: good play and bad play

PP.content: no as such where writing or play are concerned, they cannot be classically affirmed (since they have no essence) w/out being negated, le jeu et la graphie vont sans cesse disparaissant
PP.linkedContent: no as such where writing or play are concerned, they cannot be classically affirmed (since they have no essence) w/out being negated, le jeu et la graphie vont sans cesse disparaissant

PP.content: does Plato give play a chance, to take play seriously is to relieve it of its playfulness; Plato says (in Laws 803b-e) our life should be spent in play (sacrifice, song and dance), play perfectly [telos?]
PP.linkedContent: does Plato give play a chance, to take play seriously is to relieve it of its playfulness; Plato says (in Laws 803b-e) our life should be spent in play (sacrifice, song and dance), play perfectly [telos?]

PP.content: play always lost when seeks salvation in games (see OG)
PP.linkedContent: play always lost when seeks salvation in games (see OG)

VM.content: Derrida beyond Levinas: war played out btwn face and finite world w/out a face, isn’t this the difference in which absence-presence of God plays? wouldn’t this play precede God, permit us to think his essence?
VM.linkedContent: Derrida beyond Levinas: war played out btwn face and finite world w/out a face, isn’t this the difference in which absence-presence of God plays? wouldn’t this play precede God, permit us to think his essence?

VM.content: how could there be “play of the Same” if alterity were not already in the same?
VM.linkedContent: how could there be “play of the Same” if alterity were not already in the same?

PAS.content: play (w/out play) of the w/out (sans) disarticulates every identity, every contradiction > ever since the “the name of death” or nonidentity of double in the name
PAS.linkedContent: play (w/out play) of the w/out (sans) disarticulates every identity, every contradiction > ever since the “the name of death” or nonidentity of double in the name

PAS.content: dissemination does not play w/ the multiple, plural, dispersion, the apart (épars), but with the unique, the unique and itself
PAS.linkedContent: dissemination does not play w/ the multiple, plural, dispersion, the apart (épars), but with the unique, the unique and itself

T.content: intro to differance, cites, repercusses its rhythm w/out measure, incision conduite par une main aveugle pour n’avoir jamais vu que le part-et-d’autre d’un tissu > to weave (tramer) doesn’t play le jeu d’enchaînement, il joue l’enchaînement, trouer, traverser, works on both sides (le part-et-d’autre), leaves ear canal open, sous le coup d’un enchaînement simulé, non-echo
T.linkedContent: intro to differance, cites, repercusses its rhythm w/out measure, incision conduite par une main aveugle pour n’avoir jamais vu que le part-et-d’autre d’un tissu > to weave (tramer) doesn’t play le jeu d’enchaînement, il joue l’enchaînement, trouer, traverser, works on both sides (le part-et-d’autre), leaves ear canal open, sous le coup d’un enchaînement simulé, non-echo

FWT.content: where calculation reaches its limit: play, possibility of play w/in calculating machines > arrival of other produces effects in machine, but can’t be calculated by them > we shouldn’t close our eyes to extraordinary progress of calculation, to the machine, while still giving over to exposure to, play of, the other > invent discourse capable of taking this into account
FWT.linkedContent: where calculation reaches its limit: play, possibility of play w/in calculating machines > arrival of other produces effects in machine, but can’t be calculated by them > we shouldn’t close our eyes to extraordinary progress of calculation, to the machine, while still giving over to exposure to, play of, the other > invent discourse capable of taking this into account

DS.content: double mark, mark erases mark, undecidable stroke > this syntax escapes pertinence of truth, inscribes truth w/in its play [“Mallarmé exemplifies this”—suspect such a claim]
DS.linkedContent: double mark, mark erases mark, undecidable stroke > this syntax escapes pertinence of truth, inscribes truth w/in its play [“Mallarmé exemplifies this”—suspect such a claim]

DS.content: mime is acting (joue) moment he is ruled by no actual (effective) action and aims toward no verisimilitude, plays out difference w/out reference, he is not an imitator, mimes imitation
DS.linkedContent: mime is acting (joue) moment he is ruled by no actual (effective) action and aims toward no verisimilitude, plays out difference w/out reference, he is not an imitator, mimes imitation

DS.content: perpetual allusion, which plays, performed in groundless entre—undecidable
DS.linkedContent: perpetual allusion, which plays, performed in groundless entre—undecidable

DS.content: Mallarmé’s book is a block composed of sheets of paper—its “cubic perfection” is open, impossibility of closure, dehiscence as “internal” theater, practice of spacing put in play
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé’s book is a block composed of sheets of paper—its “cubic perfection” is open, impossibility of closure, dehiscence as “internal” theater, practice of spacing put in play

DS.content: Mallarmé’s play (on “plume,” on “winds [brise]”) anathema to thematization, to deciphering meaning > coin-entre
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé’s play (on “plume,” on “winds [brise]”) anathema to thematization, to deciphering meaning > coin-entre

DS.content: [quoting Mallarmé] rhythm, literary game par excellence: mimic suspense/laughter—rhythmic cadence, or case, all the falls, the silent fall of pen
DS.linkedContent: [quoting Mallarmé] rhythm, literary game par excellence: mimic suspense/laughter—rhythmic cadence, or case, all the falls, the silent fall of pen

P.content: Kant: examples are wheelchairs (Gängelwagen) [roulettes] of judgment, those who don’t have enough Mutterwitz, the sick, need these wheelchairs, prostheses that replace nothing
P.linkedContent: Kant: examples are wheelchairs (Gängelwagen) [roulettes] of judgment, those who don’t have enough Mutterwitz, the sick, need these wheelchairs, prostheses that replace nothing

P.content: Hegel: there is play in examples, they play, Beispielen
P.linkedContent: Hegel: there is play in examples, they play, Beispielen

P.content: Derrida, via Hegel: examples divert energy of ergon, introduce chance & abyss into necessity of Mutterwitz > this can make one lose one’s head, a Russian roulette (death drive and mourning of labor in experience of beautiful), to put into play pleasure w/out enjoyment
P.linkedContent: Derrida, via Hegel: examples divert energy of ergon, introduce chance & abyss into necessity of Mutterwitz > this can make one lose one’s head, a Russian roulette (death drive and mourning of labor in experience of beautiful), to put into play pleasure w/out enjoyment

P.content: only a practice of theoretical fiction can work (against) the frame, (make or let it) play (it) (against) itself
P.linkedContent: only a practice of theoretical fiction can work (against) the frame, (make or let it) play (it) (against) itself

P.content: conceptual determination of end limits free play (of imagination): sans opens play w/in beauty
P.linkedContent: conceptual determination of end limits free play (of imagination): sans opens play w/in beauty

P.content: one must choose btwn not seeing beauty & seeing the end
P.linkedContent: one must choose btwn not seeing beauty & seeing the end

POS.content: to risk meaning nothing is to start to play, enter play of differance which prevents any word, any concept, from summarizing or governing from a theological presence, centralizing the movement and spacing of differences
POS.linkedContent: to risk meaning nothing is to start to play, enter play of differance which prevents any word, any concept, from summarizing or governing from a theological presence, centralizing the movement and spacing of differences

POS.content: dissemination is play of castration w/out metaphysical/romantic pathos of negativity > dissemination “is” angle of play of castration
POS.linkedContent: dissemination is play of castration w/out metaphysical/romantic pathos of negativity > dissemination “is” angle of play of castration

FS.content: attempt-to-write, moment of overflow (can’t be understand via voluntarism): when play of meaning overflows signification, which is always enveloped by limits of nature, life, soul
FS.linkedContent: attempt-to-write, moment of overflow (can’t be understand via voluntarism): when play of meaning overflows signification, which is always enveloped by limits of nature, life, soul

DIF.content: play: unity of chance & necessity in calculations w/out end (beyond opposition philosophical-logical/empirical-logical) (on eve of philosophy and beyond it)
DIF.linkedContent: play: unity of chance & necessity in calculations w/out end (beyond opposition philosophical-logical/empirical-logical) (on eve of philosophy and beyond it)

DIF.content: differance (is) older than ontological difference: outside epochality of Being (outside epoch): no depth to bottomless chessboard on which Being is put to play
DIF.linkedContent: differance (is) older than ontological difference: outside epochality of Being (outside epoch): no depth to bottomless chessboard on which Being is put to play

DIF.content: is this why Heraclitean play of hen diapheron heautōi, the one differing from itself, in difference w/ itself, is lost like a trace when diapherein is determined as ontological difference?
DIF.linkedContent: is this why Heraclitean play of hen diapheron heautōi, the one differing from itself, in difference w/ itself, is lost like a trace when diapherein is determined as ontological difference?

DIF.content: [Derrida argues for new relation  to unnameable, different from Heidegger’s] “no name” for differance is not ineffable Being which no name could approach (i.e. God), it is play which makes possible nominal effects, the chains of substitutions of names
DIF.linkedContent: [Derrida argues for new relation to unnameable, different from Heidegger’s] “no name” for differance is not ineffable Being which no name could approach (i.e. God), it is play which makes possible nominal effects, the chains of substitutions of names

DIF.content: there will be no unique name: must think this w/out nostalgia, hors du myth of pure mom/dad language, must affirm like Nietzsche met l’affirmation en jeu, dans un rire et un pas de la danse
DIF.linkedContent: there will be no unique name: must think this w/out nostalgia, hors du myth of pure mom/dad language, must affirm like Nietzsche met l’affirmation en jeu, dans un rire et un pas de la danse

RGE.content: by interpreting negativity as labor, by betting for discourse/meaning/history, Hegel bet against play, chance, blinded himself to what made his own bet possible > each stage through spirit (each suspension of play) was a phase of play: play includes work of meaning (meaning of work) not in terms of knowledge but in terms of inscription: meaning inscribed in meaningless play
RGE.linkedContent: by interpreting negativity as labor, by betting for discourse/meaning/history, Hegel bet against play, chance, blinded himself to what made his own bet possible > each stage through spirit (each suspension of play) was a phase of play: play includes work of meaning (meaning of work) not in terms of knowledge but in terms of inscription: meaning inscribed in meaningless play

RGE.content: Bataille wanted to denounce servility/labor of meaning by engaging in major play, not minor (which would still give meaning to the absence of meaning)
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille wanted to denounce servility/labor of meaning by engaging in major play, not minor (which would still give meaning to the absence of meaning)

RGE.content: Bataille’s communication, only btwn beings who have put the being w/in themselves at stake (mis en jeu) > “placé à la limite de la mort, du néant”
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille’s communication, only btwn beings who have put the being w/in themselves at stake (mis en jeu) > “placé à la limite de la mort, du néant”

RGE.content: this stratagem, the sovereign operation, play w/ syntax, does not subordinate itself to an anticipated discourse
RGE.linkedContent: this stratagem, the sovereign operation, play w/ syntax, does not subordinate itself to an anticipated discourse

RGE.content: Bataille’s sovereignty is not neutral even if it neutralizes all oppositions of classical logic
RGE.linkedContent: Bataille’s sovereignty is not neutral even if it neutralizes all oppositions of classical logic

RGE.content: affirmation of play outside meaning: potlach of signs that burns, consumes, wastes words in gay affirmation of death: a sacrifice & a challenge
RGE.linkedContent: affirmation of play outside meaning: potlach of signs that burns, consumes, wastes words in gay affirmation of death: a sacrifice & a challenge

RGE.content: sovereign operation, like all transgressions, must conserve/confirm what it exceeds
RGE.linkedContent: sovereign operation, like all transgressions, must conserve/confirm what it exceeds

RM.content: [cf. Pas] the dérive or dérapage (skidding) as un certain jeu de l’ancre in surrounding waters (parages): Derrida can only stop engines (machines) of this floating vehicle [my discourse on metaphor], which would still abandon it to its unforeseeable dérive [more metaphorico]
RM.linkedContent: [cf. Pas] the dérive or dérapage (skidding) as un certain jeu de l’ancre in surrounding waters (parages): Derrida can only stop engines (machines) of this floating vehicle [my discourse on metaphor], which would still abandon it to its unforeseeable dérive [more metaphorico]

D.content: in Soller’s Numbers, since “as such” is no longer in control, the exhibited functions of text are not montrée but montée (not displayed but put in play, not staged but engaged…)
D.linkedContent: in Soller’s Numbers, since “as such” is no longer in control, the exhibited functions of text are not montrée but montée (not displayed but put in play, not staged but engaged…)

D.content: pure present: la plénitude inentamée, la continuité vierge de la non-coupure (not yet having been written, à la veille du jeu)
D.linkedContent: pure present: la plénitude inentamée, la continuité vierge de la non-coupure (not yet having been written, à la veille du jeu)

D.content: whiteness of virgin paper, blankness of transparent column, air > more than neutrality of some medium, uncovers space of play, play of space
D.linkedContent: whiteness of virgin paper, blankness of transparent column, air > more than neutrality of some medium, uncovers space of play, play of space

PPT.content: event makes a contract w/ itself at instant when singularity of trait divides, in order to link itself to play, chance & economy of language > set economy going by exposing it to chance
PPT.linkedContent: event makes a contract w/ itself at instant when singularity of trait divides, in order to link itself to play, chance & economy of language > set economy going by exposing it to chance

PPT.content: [re: uses of passe-partout] there could always be one use that could be taken out of the series and surround the rest, play among the others, one more turn
PPT.linkedContent: [re: uses of passe-partout] there could always be one use that could be taken out of the series and surround the rest, play among the others, one more turn

C.content: play of supplement can go on ad infinitum, or almost [?]
C.linkedContent: play of supplement can go on ad infinitum, or almost [?]

LI.content: did Derrida make seriousness of philosophical discourse skid towards literary play [parasitizing Descartes’ title in SEC]? unless seriousness were already the para-site of such play
LI.linkedContent: did Derrida make seriousness of philosophical discourse skid towards literary play [parasitizing Descartes’ title in SEC]? unless seriousness were already the para-site of such play

LI.content: no “completeness” where freeplay is concerned > freeplay an inadequate translation of jeu (& network connected to it): “freeplay” [in deconstruction] greatly overestimated in U.S.
LI.linkedContent: no “completeness” where freeplay is concerned > freeplay an inadequate translation of jeu (& network connected to it): “freeplay” [in deconstruction] greatly overestimated in U.S.

ATM.content: if a work signifies expenditure (dépense) or pure loss (perte) in a game, it would still be determined by economy
ATM.linkedContent: if a work signifies expenditure (dépense) or pure loss (perte) in a game, it would still be determined by economy

ATM.content: Levinas plays a game that’s not a game, the gratuity of his work, what he still calls liturgy > “it is ethics itself”
ATM.linkedContent: Levinas plays a game that’s not a game, the gratuity of his work, what he still calls liturgy > “it is ethics itself”

E.content: for Kant, difference btwn free, liberal art and mercenary art is the difference btwn play/work
E.linkedContent: for Kant, difference btwn free, liberal art and mercenary art is the difference btwn play/work

OG.content: play as absence of transcendental signified; that is, the deconstruction of ontothelogy and MOP; this secousse de cet ébranlement, working in metaphysics from the start t
OG.linkedContent: play as absence of transcendental signified; that is, the deconstruction of ontothelogy and MOP; this secousse de cet ébranlement, working in metaphysics from the start t

OG.content: for Plato (Phaedrus 277e), play, childishness, paidia of writing opposed to adult gravity (spoudè) of speech
OG.linkedContent: for Plato (Phaedrus 277e), play, childishness, paidia of writing opposed to adult gravity (spoudè) of speech

OG.content: to think play radically must follow Husserl and Heidegger to the end, conserve legibility of their thought, must know le jeu du monde before attempting to understand all forms of play in the world > play, as absence of transcendental signified, not a play in the world
OG.linkedContent: to think play radically must follow Husserl and Heidegger to the end, conserve legibility of their thought, must know le jeu du monde before attempting to understand all forms of play in the world > play, as absence of transcendental signified, not a play in the world

OG.content: unity of sound & meaning (sens): reassuring closing (fermeture) of play
OG.linkedContent: unity of sound & meaning (sens): reassuring closing (fermeture) of play

OG.content: desire to restrict (lier) le jeu is irresistible
OG.linkedContent: desire to restrict (lier) le jeu is irresistible

OG.content: masturbation & writing totally indistinguishable inasmuch as each puts into play (met en jeu) the presence of the present, the life of the living
OG.linkedContent: masturbation & writing totally indistinguishable inasmuch as each puts into play (met en jeu) the presence of the present, the life of the living

OG.content: supplementarity is nothing, not absence, presence, not essence/substance of man: it’s the opening of play (jeu) btwn presence/absence, dislocation of proper of man, the impossibility and thus the desire for proximity to self (pure presence)
OG.linkedContent: supplementarity is nothing, not absence, presence, not essence/substance of man: it’s the opening of play (jeu) btwn presence/absence, dislocation of proper of man, the impossibility and thus the desire for proximity to self (pure presence)

OG.content: approach to limits (madness, divinity, childhood, animality, etc.) feared as threat of death & desired as life w/out differance: truth-value of these limit concepts only has meaning w/in closure of game (clôture du jeu), they belong to an epoch of supplementarity
OG.linkedContent: approach to limits (madness, divinity, childhood, animality, etc.) feared as threat of death & desired as life w/out differance: truth-value of these limit concepts only has meaning w/in closure of game (clôture du jeu), they belong to an epoch of supplementarity

OG.content: for Rousseau, fête w/out object, sans masques, sans dépense, sans sacrifice: no play if play is exchange of presence/absence, chance & absolute risk > fête represses relation to death
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, fête w/out object, sans masques, sans dépense, sans sacrifice: no play if play is exchange of presence/absence, chance & absolute risk > fête represses relation to death

SPEC.content: what is the child’s debt in a play w/out debt? on what w/out debt does play speculate in secret? what is the place of such a secret? [re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche]
SPEC.linkedContent: what is the child’s debt in a play w/out debt? on what w/out debt does play speculate in secret? what is the place of such a secret? [re: Freud’s debt to Nietzsche]

SPEC.content: for Freud, work consists in rassembler, searching in order to bring together, reuniting in order to give back (pour rendre) > play is dispersion that sends far away > fort/da is “a game (un jeu)”: reassemble the reassembling & dispersion, give & take back by oneself [work & play ?]
SPEC.linkedContent: for Freud, work consists in rassembler, searching in order to bring together, reuniting in order to give back (pour rendre) > play is dispersion that sends far away > fort/da is “a game (un jeu)”: reassemble the reassembling & dispersion, give & take back by oneself [work & play ?]
